context: eyond human experience, catching us off-guard and therefore are causing catastrophic losses to lives, livelihoods, and properties. to make matters worse, one impact often has a domino effect or "impact cascade". it is becoming clear that, while climate change will impact us all, some of us are more at risk than others. those living of the ‘edges’ of society, under social and economic stress, will suffer the most and are the least prepared. this project mobilizes diverse partners and social groups in the u.s. and mexico to understand, visualize, and address the myriad impacts of climate change on wate
title: PIRE: Co-Creating Research and Education Capacities to Understand, Visualize and Mitigate Climate-Change Impact Cascades and Inequities in Central Mexico
explanation: The phrase "at risk" refers to vulnerable populations who are disproportionately affected by climate change due to their social and economic circumstances, which aligns with social equity and political considerations.
